com.skobbler.ngx.map
Class SKCalloutView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.RelativeLayout
              com.skobbler.ngx.map.SKCalloutView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
public class SKCalloutView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout

Callout view that can be used to display information about points on the map. Clients should extend this class in order to display data in the map callout in a custom way.

Version:
3.0

Method Detail

showAtLocation

public void showAtLocation(SKCoordinate coordinates,
                           boolean showTail)
Show the callout on map at the specified coordinates.
Note: callout will not be shown if coordinates are null.

Parameters:
coordinates - Lat/Lng coordinates
showTail - set to true to show the tail

hide

public void hide()
Hide the callout. Convenience method for setVisibility(GONE)

setTailColor

public void setTailColor(int color)
Set the tail color

Parameters:
color - The new color (including alpha) to set in the paint.

Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.

setCustomView

public SKCalloutView setCustomView(android.view.View customView)
Set a custom view for the whole callout. This view will replace the default callout layout.
Note: once a custom view is set, all customization methods except setTailColor(int) will stop working. All further customization and click handling will rely on the custom view's creator.

Parameters:
customView - view to replace the default view

getVerticalOffset

public float getVerticalOffset()

Specify an offset between the callout and y coordinate

Parameters:
verticalOffset - offset in px

getMinimumZoomLevel

public int getMinimumZoomLevel()
Returns the minimum zoom level from which the callout view will be seen on the map. Default value is 1.

Returns:
the minimum zoom level from which the callout view is seen on the

setMinimumZoomLevel

public void setMinimumZoomLevel(int minimumZoomLevel)
Sets the minimum zoom level from which the callout view will be seen on the map. Default value is 1.

Parameters:
minimumZoomLevel - new value for minimum zoom level.
